citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The licensee has not been giving monthly heartworm preventative to the dogs. The Program of Veterinary Care (PVC)
instructs the licensee in how to provide adequate veterinary care to prevent diseases. With regards to heartworm
disease, it requires the administration of a preventative product (Ivermectin) orally each month for adult dogs. The
licensee states he has not given heartworm prevention in a few years. The inspector spoke with the Attending
Veterinarian who confirmed the prescription of monthly heartworm preventative use. Failure to properly administer
heartworm prevention can lead to the development of this disease, which spreads through mosquitos, and can cause
coughing, heart disease, pain and/or distress to dogs. Correct by ensuring that adequate care is provided to all dogs
including the administration of heartworm preventative medication as required in the PVC. Correct by: May 17, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The licensee has not been giving monthly heartworm preventative to the dogs. The Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) 
instructs the licensee in how to provide adequate veterinary care to prevent diseases.  With regards to heartworm 
disease, it requires the administration of a preventative product (Ivermectin) orally each month for adult dogs. The 
licensee states he has not given heartworm prevention in a few years. The inspector spoke with the Attending 
Veterinarian who confirmed the prescription of monthly heartworm preventative use. Failure to properly administer 
heartworm prevention can lead to the development of this disease, which spreads through mosquitos, and can cause 
coughing, heart disease, pain and/or distress to dogs. Correct by ensuring that adequate care is provided to all dogs 
including the administration of heartworm preventative medication as required in the PVC. Correct by: May 17, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
